intro: Monnina crassinervia, commonly known as broad-veined monnina, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America, particularly the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered leaves with prominent veins. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, appearing in late spring to early summer. Monnina crassinervia is often found in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to thrive in drought conditions.
